fields.description:
h4. +Steps to reproduce+
# install REST API Browser plugin
# go to JIRA Administration -> System
# enter password to activate Administration Session (WebSudo)
# look for REST API Browser from the bottom of the page and open it

h4. +Expected behavior+
The Search box of the REST API browser is visible:
!searchbox.png|thumbnail!

h4. +Actual behavior+
The Search box of the REST API browser is hidden by the WebSudo banner:
!websudo.png|thumbnail!

h4. +Workarounds+
# REST API browser doesn't require Administration Access, so when viewing the page with the WebSudo banner, simply clicking Drop Access will show the Search box
# When WebSudo is not enabled e.g. right after logging in JIRA, typing *G* then *G* (quickly) then "REST API browser" then directly going to it will bypass the WebSudo banner
# [Disabling WebSudo|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Secure+Administrator+Sessions#ConfiguringSecureAdministratorSessions-DisablingSecureAdministratorSessions] will permanently disable the WebSudo banner, as well as Administration Access

h4. +Notes+
# If there's an [Announcement Banner|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+an+Announcement+Banner], that banner will also hide the Search box. In this case, the only way to show the Search box is to clear the Announcement Banner
# If both WebSudo and Announcement Banners are available, the WebSudo Banner will hide both the Announcement Banner and the Search box, then clicking Drop Access will only show the Announcement Banner
fields.summary: WebSudo or Announcement Banner hides REST API Browser's Search box
Feature to allow smart Filter creation based another filter
Add additional fields/entries to versions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44463].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
There is currently no way to categorize web links, the way issue links are categorized by issue-link types in the issue view. This would be useful in use-cases that require lots of web links to JIRA issues.

In extension, if Web Link categories are available, jql function facilites (provided especially by 3rd party plugins) could also make it possible to search for issues with links falling under specific categories.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a feature for organizing web links to categories
fields.summary: Web Link Categories

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Sorting a filter field when viewing in "My Defaults" column configuration, automatically switches the column configuration

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Select a filter in Issue Navigator
# Make sure the  Column view is set to *Filter* View.
!IssueNavigator.png|thumbnail!
# Remove a field or two and re-arrange the fields, while still in *Filter* Columns views.
In my example I have removed *Epic Name* and *Epic Link* field from the filter and have brought *Updated* column to the first column.
!FilterRe-arranged.png|thumbnail!
# Note down the changes made to the fields.
# Now change back to *My Defaults* Columns View.
!MyDefaultView.png|thumbnail!
_Notice the Fields in this view_
# Now try to sort a field, while still in *My Defaults* Columns View
In my example I ascending sort the *Summary* field.
!AccendSort.png|thumbnail!
_Notice that in the above screenshot, the sorted result has is displayed in the *Filter* view instead of remaining in the *My Defaults* view_.

h3. Expected Results
The Field should have sorted the field ascending, while remaining in the *My defaults* view.

h3. Actual Results
The field in sorted, however the Columns View is changed to *Filter* view.
fields.summary: Sorting a filter field when viewing in "My Defaults" column configuration, automatically switches the column configuration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44460].
  {panel}

*Suggestion:*
User would like the ability to use text formatting on a block of text ( multiple row of text ) .
Currently text formatting only works with a single row of text. 

For example when there is a block of text , after selecting the whole block and selecting Bold, the text will not be bold. Please refer to the screenshot below :

1. Enter a few rows of text. Please hit enter after each row to go to the next row. 
!screen1.png|thumbnail!
2. When previewing the text, it is not actually bold
!screen2.png|thumbnail!


*Workaround :*
Install & use the 3rd party plugin called [JEditor - Rich Text Editor for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.jiraeditor.jeditor] 
!jeditor.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to apply text formatting (eg: italic, bold style) to a block of text

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44458].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently you can use JavaScript in any description field. This can modify JIRA behaviour in very strange way. There is no way to trace that from configuration point of view. More over you can't see added JavaScript code in Debugger, which makes troubleshooting very hard.  

h3. Suggested Solution
# Disable JavaScript in Description field by default
# Make special configuration option to enable JavaScript in that field
#*  Enable HTML in custom field descriptions and list item values.
# wrap the code in 
{code}
<script type='text/javascript'>
...
//# sourceURL= <GENERATED_PLACE_HOLDER>.js
</script>
{code}
# Make UI/cli report which shows list of fields with JavaScript

h3. Notes
Starting from Jira 8.7.0, we will switch the default option of "_Enable HTML in custom field descriptions and list item values_" to OFF - see JRASERVER-70858, JRASERVER-70859

h3. Workaround 
Partial, add  line to your JavaScript code {{//# sourceURL= <GENERATED_PLACE_HOLDER>.js}}, so it will be visible to debugger.
fields.summary: Using JavaScript in description field should require explicit configuration

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Custom Field Text Field (single line) and Custom Field Text Field (multi-line) are unable to handle the value "-1"
* Only when keying "-1 ", other negative number and 0 is not affected

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new custom field Custom Field Text Field (single line) and Custom Field Text Field (multi-line)
# Go to create issue
# Enter value "-1" for both fields
# Value will not be able to shown and when using "Where's my field", its stated that the field is having null value

h3. Expected Results
* To be able to shown the value "-1"
h3. Actual Results
* "-1" is treated as null value

h3.Workaround
* To have space before -1 "<space>-1", eg: " -1"
fields.summary: Unable to set "-1" string value in text field custom field
JS error when viewing activity streams in wallboard mode

fields.description:
This is because the count is obtained from {{UserUtil#getActiveUserCount}} while the user list is from crowd directly. The difference between the users is that getActiveCount returns the amount of Jira active users with *use permission* while crowd gets the total of active users.
Currently, the favourite filter (the one currently using it) is not affected by this amount difference.
fields.summary: REST plugin UserListResolver has a mismatch between the user count and list when share permissions are global

fields.description:
h3. Summary
E-mail protocol details are not logged in JIRA 6.4+ when Outgoing Mail Debug is enabled

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA 6.4 or later.
# Configure an SMTP server and enable outgoing mail debug on [Logging and Profiling|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Logging+and+Profiling].
# Trigger an event which will send a notification.
# Wait until the mail queue is flushed (or flush it manually).

h3. Expected Results
All the e-mail protocol details, including the e-mail message itself should be included in the logs. This used to be the behaviour on JIRA 6.3.x and earlier versions.
A sample e-mail debug log file from JIRA 6.3.15 has been attached and can be downloaded in the following link: [^atlassian-jira-outgoing-mail.log]

h3. Actual Results
The entries below are written to the {{atlassian-jira-outgoing-mail.log}} file:
{noformat}
2015-07-22 15:17:39,553 DEBUG [] Sending mailitem To='user@email.com' Subject='(DEMO-1) What is an issue?' From='null' FromName='admin (JIRA)' Cc='null' Bcc='null' ReplyTo='null' InReplyTo='null' MimeType='text/html' Encoding='UTF-8' Multipart='javax.mail.internet.MimeMultipart@5dbe3648' MessageId='null' admin 917x335x1 1d308w6 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/MailQueueAdmin.jspa Getting session
2015-07-22 15:17:39,557 DEBUG [] Sending mailitem To='user@email.com' Subject='(DEMO-1) What is an issue?' From='null' FromName='admin (JIRA)' Cc='null' Bcc='null' ReplyTo='null' InReplyTo='null' MimeType='text/html' Encoding='UTF-8' Multipart='javax.mail.internet.MimeMultipart@5dbe3648' MessageId='null' admin 917x335x1 1d308w6 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/MailQueueAdmin.jspa Session providers: [[javax.mail.Provider[STORE,imap,com.sun.mail.imap.IMAPStore,Sun Microsystems, Inc], javax.mail.Provider[STORE,imaps,com.sun.mail.imap.IMAPSSLStore,Sun Microsystems, Inc], javax.mail.Provider[TRANSPORT,smtp,com.sun.mail.smtp.SMTPTransport,Sun Microsystems, Inc], javax.mail.Provider[TRANSPORT,smtps,com.sun.mail.smtp.SMTPSSLTransport,Sun Microsystems, Inc], javax.mail.Provider[STORE,pop3,com.sun.mail.pop3.POP3Store,Sun Microsystems, Inc], javax.mail.Provider[STORE,pop3s,com.sun.mail.pop3.POP3SSLStore,Sun Microsystems, Inc]]]
2015-07-22 15:17:39,557 DEBUG [] Sending mailitem To='user@email.com' Subject='(DEMO-1) What is an issue?' From='null' FromName='admin (JIRA)' Cc='null' Bcc='null' ReplyTo='null' InReplyTo='null' MimeType='text/html' Encoding='UTF-8' Multipart='javax.mail.internet.MimeMultipart@5dbe3648' MessageId='null' admin 917x335x1 1d308w6 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/MailQueueAdmin.jspa Session addressMap: [{rfc822=smtp}]
2015-07-22 15:17:39,559 DEBUG [] Sending mailitem To='user@email.com' Subject='(DEMO-1) What is an issue?' From='null' FromName='admin (JIRA)' Cc='null' Bcc='null' ReplyTo='null' InReplyTo='null' MimeType='text/html' Encoding='UTF-8' Multipart='javax.mail.internet.MimeMultipart@5dbe3648' MessageId='null' admin 917x335x1 1d308w6 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/MailQueueAdmin.jspa Getting transport for protocol [smtps]
2015-07-22 15:17:39,559 DEBUG [] Sending mailitem To='user@email.com' Subject='(DEMO-1) What is an issue?' From='null' FromName='admin (JIRA)' Cc='null' Bcc='null' ReplyTo='null' InReplyTo='null' MimeType='text/html' Encoding='UTF-8' Multipart='javax.mail.internet.MimeMultipart@5dbe3648' MessageId='null' admin 917x335x1 1d308w6 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/MailQueueAdmin.jspa Got transport: [smtps:]. Connecting
2015-07-22 15:17:41,352 DEBUG [] Sending mailitem To='user@email.com' Subject='(DEMO-1) What is an issue?' From='null' FromName='admin (JIRA)' Cc='null' Bcc='null' ReplyTo='null' InReplyTo='null' MimeType='text/html' Encoding='UTF-8' Multipart='javax.mail.internet.MimeMultipart@5dbe3648' MessageId='null' admin 917x335x1 1d308w6 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/MailQueueAdmin.jspa Sending message
2015-07-22 15:17:43,323 DEBUG [] Sending mailitem To='user@email.com' Subject='(DEMO-1) What is an issue?' From='null' FromName='admin (JIRA)' Cc='null' Bcc='null' ReplyTo='null' InReplyTo='null' MimeType='text/html' Encoding='UTF-8' Multipart='javax.mail.internet.MimeMultipart@5dbe3648' MessageId='null' admin 917x335x1 1d308w6 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/MailQueueAdmin.jspa Message was sent with Message-Id <JIRA.10000.1437588011000.1.1437589059553@Atlassian.JIRA>
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
# Set the property {{-Dmail.debug=true}} and restart JIRA. See [Setting properties and options on startup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Setting+properties+and+options+on+startup] for details on how to do this.
# Enable Outgoing Mail debug on [Logging and Profiling|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Logging+and+Profiling].
(!) *Both* parameters above must be configured to write the protocol details in the {{atlassian-jira-outgoing-mail.log}} file.
fields.summary: E-mail protocol details are not written in JIRA 6.4+ even with Outgoing Mail Debug enabled

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h3. Summary
Version Picker (multiple versions) field gives nullpointerexception on Issue Navigator as well as on "Edit Default Screen" if context has IssueType as well as Project 

h3. Environment
* Reproduced with JIRA 6.4.7


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add some versions for the project
# Configure a custom field of type Version Picker (multiple versions)
# Now, configure the context of the field to use some specific Projects as well as Issue types *instead of Global context*(see screenshot)
# Run a re-index of JIRA
# Create some issues with this field
# Search for these issues on Issue Navigator or try to edit the default value of the custom field.

h3. Expected Results
The issues show up properly. 
The default value can be edited without any problem.


h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
2015-07-14 13:04:12,587 ajp-8009-13 DEBUG aaaaa 784x74040x1 kan0la 192.168.100.36 /rest/issueNav/1/issueTable/stable [com.atlassian.ozymandias.SafePluginPointAccess] Unable to run plugin code because of 'java.lang.NullPointerException - null'.
java.lang.NullPointerException
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.VersionCFType.getUnreleasedVersionFirst(VersionCFType.java:288)
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.VersionCFType.getVelocityParameters(VersionCFType.java:273)
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.CustomFieldUtils.buildParams(CustomFieldUtils.java:475)
at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.customfield.CustomFieldTypeModuleDescriptorImpl.getViewHtmlByValue(CustomFieldTypeModuleDescriptorImpl.java:345)
at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.customfield.CustomFieldTypeModuleDescriptorImpl.access$100(CustomFieldTypeModuleDescriptorImpl.java:46){noformat}

 

h3.Workaround
The workaround is to switch to Global context and then re-index the instance.
fields.summary: Version Picker (multiple versions) field gives nullpointerexception if context has IssueType as well as Project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44442].
  {panel}

h2. Feature Request:
----

Currently in order to trigger workflow transitions you have to connect a post function to a web hook. 
This can get a little tedious and in the long run isn't really scalable for instances with a large amount of workflows. Offer the ability to manage default workflow transitions in web hooks. It would fall under the front facing documentation umbrella that mentions: "JIRA supports webhooks for all standard issue-related events."

----

*Screenshot of the Web-hook admin page:*
!j.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allow default workflow transitions to be selected from the admin page when creating web hooks.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44441].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there is no option to select all screens, in a single checkbox, for a custom field. This could especially be a problem if the admin has a large number of screens and he has to select them one by one. The following screenshot better explains the problem:
!customfieldscreens.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
Have a *select all* option at the top of the list, that will automatically select all screens for that particular custom field.
fields.summary: As an admin I want to be able to select all screens, using single checkbox, for Custom Fields
Ability to receive a notification if any changes in the user management

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44437].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
It's pretty tedious to make a field *Required*. One would have to create a custom field, add it to a screen and then navigate to *Field Configuration* to make it required. The user will then have to make sure that this Field Configuration is then applied to the correct Scheme and Issue Type of the scheme

h3. Suggestion
Make it easier by placing a checkbox beside every field when configuring the screen. Tick the checkbox if you want a field to be required.
fields.summary: Easier way to make a field required
An 'Issue commented' notification should always be sent for a new comment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44431].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When an application link is created, *all* projects in JIRA will be able to link to the remote application.

In some cases, only certain projects need the functionality to link to a remote application. It is not needed for *all* projects to be able to link remotely and it will only add confusion for some of the users.

h3. Suggestion
Ability to restrict AppLink features to only certain projects.
fields.summary: Restrict Application Link to certain projects
Zephyr not working on JIRA Cloud

fields.description:
h4. Summary
When performing sync on an LDAP user directories, user lost it's group membership inside *JIRA Users* global permission. This causes users to be redirected to Service Desk portal (as expected), as JIRA couldn't find any group associated to them and treat them as Service Desk customer

h4. Environment
*JIRA* 6.4.7
*JIRA Service Desk* 2.5.0

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA and Service Desk
# Have user login to JIRA and work on an issue
# Sync LDAP User Directory into JIRA, which has the same user base with the Internal Directory

h4. Expected Results
LDAP User Directory synced successfully, and user session is retained

h4. Actual Results
User lost its membership during the sync. User login session is kept as long as they didn't navigate out of the page. So, once they perform an action or navigate out of the page, they are redirected to a Customer Portal

h4. Notes
This is currently *not reproducible* at will. Raising this problem as bug, to gather more information in case another user experienced the same problem
fields.summary: JIRA user is wrongly redirected to Service Desk portal during LDAP sync

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Microsoft IIS can return a HTTP 400 if a DELETE HTTP method is requested with a payload. The JIRA Workflow designer will use this approach when deleting a status.

h3. Environment

Microsoft IIS 7.5 is serving traffic on front of JIRA.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Delete a workflow status.

h3. Expected Results

The status is successfully deleted and returns a 200.

h3. Actual Results

The delete is submitted with a payload and as such IIS will return a 400 as it ignores the request, returning a 400 as described in [JIRA Functionality fails due to HTTP 400 Bad Request Error|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+Functionality+fails+due+to+HTTP+400+Bad+Request+Error].
fields.summary: Deleting a JIRA Workflow Status results in a HTTP 400 when using Microsoft IIS

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The JIRA *Scheduler Administration* shows the _com.atlassian.sal.jira.scheduling.JiraPluginScheduler_ > _JiraPluginScheduler:Service Provider Session Remover_ is failing with a java.lang.NullPointerException when there are expired tokens for an old Application link.

JIRA is reports the error: "'JiraPluginScheduler:Service Provider Session Remover' failed java.lang.NullPointerException: consumer a NullPointerException" when the scheduler fired.

{code}
2015-05-18 13:39:13,569 atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.local_Worker-4 ERROR ServiceRunner [atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher] Scheduled job with ID 'JiraPluginScheduler:Service Provider Session Remover' failed
java.lang.NullPointerException: consumer
	at com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkNotNull(Preconditions.java:204)
	at com.atlassian.oauth.Token$TokenBuilder.consumer(Token.java:179)
	at com.atlassian.jira.oauth.serviceprovider.OfBizServiceProviderTokenStore.createTokenFromGV(OfBizServiceProviderTokenStore.java:392)
	at com.atlassian.jira.oauth.serviceprovider.OfBizServiceProviderTokenStore.removeExpiredTokens(OfBizServiceProviderTokenStore.java:292)
	at com.atlassian.jira.oauth.serviceprovider.OfBizServiceProviderTokenStore.removeExpiredTokensAndNotify(OfBizServiceProviderTokenStore.java:276)
	at com.atlassian.jira.oauth.serviceprovider.CachingServiceProviderTokenStore.removeExpiredTokensAndNotify(CachingServiceProviderTokenStore.java:126)  <+2> (DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:307)
	at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.doInvoke(ServiceInvoker.java:58)
	at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.invoke(ServiceInvoker.java:62)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.doProceed(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:131)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:119)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.osgi.service.util.internal.aop.ServiceTCCLInterceptor.invokeUnprivileged(ServiceTCCLInterceptor.java:56)
	at org.springframework.osgi.service.util.internal.aop.ServiceTCCLInterceptor.invoke(ServiceTCCLInterceptor.java:39)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.LocalBundleContextAdvice.invoke(LocalBundleContextAdvice.java:59)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.doProceed(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:131)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:119)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:204)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy1412.removeExpiredTokensAndNotify(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.oauth.serviceprovider.internal.DelegatingTokenStoreImpl.removeExpiredTokensAndNotify(DelegatingTokenStoreImpl.java:48)
	at com.atlassian.oauth.serviceprovider.internal.ExpiredSessionRemover.execute(ExpiredSessionRemover.java:20)
	at com.atlassian.sal.jira.scheduling.JiraPluginScheduler$JobDescriptor.runJob(JiraPluginScheduler.java:130)
	at com.atlassian.sal.jira.scheduling.JiraPluginScheduler.runJob(JiraPluginScheduler.java:91)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.runJob(JobLauncher.java:136)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.launchAndBuildResponse(JobLauncher.java:101)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.launch(JobLauncher.java:80)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.quartz1.Quartz1Job.execute(Quartz1Job.java:32)
	at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:223)
	at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:549)
{code}


h3. Environment
This appears when application links have existed with other Atlassian Applications, but have since been removed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
It is not clear how the instance originally managed to get into a state where the invalid application link tokens existed.

h3. Expected Results
If a token for a application (that doesn't exist) has expired, it should be removed without error.

h3. Actual Results
The Scheduled Service fails to remove the invalid token.

h3. Notes
There is a possible workaround, however we recommend that you contact [JIRA Support|https://support.atlassian.com] before making any changes so that we can verify this issue. We recommend making an Offline backup of JIRA before completing the steps below:

# Shutdown JIRA
# Take a backup of your Database.
# Locate the list of application links in the JIRA database:
{code:SQL}
select distinct consumer_key from oauthspconsumer;
{code}
# Locate the list of tokens in the JIRA database:
{code:SQL}
select distinct consumer_key from oauthsptoken;
{code}
# If you are seeing the "NullPointerException as pasted above and the results of the SQL queries above DO NOT match run the following:
{code:SQL}
DELETE FROM oauthsptoken WHERE consumer_key not in
	(SELECT distinct consumer_key from oauthspconsumer);
{code}
# Restart JIRA.
fields.summary: Scheduler Administration JiraPluginScheduler shows a java.lang.NullPointerException exception

fields.description:
{quote} We have thousands of saved filters. When trying to search for an existing filter in a dashboard gadget or from the search for filters in the manage filters section we are getting an error for filters that exist with the following syntax.

LPM (DOCSIS) - All

It doesn't seem to like the parentheses in the name. We have many filters broken out like this. I am attaching a few screen shots form the manage filter search area. The first two error out (yes I tried to escape this as well.) The third returns 400+ results. It is even worse trying to find one in the dashboard gadget with the filter gadget. 
{quote}

h3. Summary
* Using parantheses "()" in filter search seems to provide inaccurate result and throws error

h3. Environment
* 6.4.7

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have several filter using variation of name "LPM (DOCSIS)","(DOCSIS) *" ,"* (DOCSIS)"
# Go to {{Issues > Manage Filters > Search}}
# Perform the search by typing the filter name partially eg: "LPM (DO"
# Search the filter by typing the filter name fully "LPM (DOCSIS)"

h3. Expected Results
* To be able to search through the filter

h3. Actual Results
* Trying to search filter for "LPM (DOCSIS) - All"
* If search the filter by typing the filter name partially eg: "LPM (DO"
** Error is thrown " Could not parse the query text. Leading wildcards are not supported"
* If search the filter by typing the filter name fully "LPM (DOCSIS)"
** Will not get accurate search, will return result for (DOCSIS) related rather than the full LPM (DOCSIS) only

h3.Workaround
* To search for LPM (DOCSIS), ensure parantheses is closed, for eg:
** LPM (DO) instead of LPM (DO to avoid the error " Could not parse the query text. Leading wildcards are not supported" being thrown

h3. Notes
* Seems like the search are concentrating to the value inside the parantheses (XXX) and return based on that
fields.summary: JIRA throws an error when searching for a saved filter.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44418].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
On JIRA instances that heavily use mail handlers, the {{notificationinstance}} table can grow a lot, which ends up causing performance issues - specially since it appears that JIRA does a full table scan frequently. On Oracle DBs, this can be costly and degrade server performance.

h3. Suggested Solution
We should delete older entries from the table, similarly to what we did with the {{NotificationInstanceKiller}} that we implement as an upgrade task after JIRA 5.2 (see [this page|https://developer.atlassian.com/static/javadoc/jira/5.2/reference/com/atlassian/jira/startup/NotificationInstanceKiller.html#deleteAfterDelay] for more details). Also, we could add an index in the database for this table, to improve performance when searching on it.
fields.summary: Periodically clean up the notificationinstance table

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44416]. {panel} *Problem* A user may report an intermittent issue and it would be helpful to know which host they are using when they access through Data Center just in case the issue is server related. For example: {quote}I have two nodes in a Data Center cluster. Users connect to JIRA via an alias that points to a load balancer that will serve one of the two nodes. My question is, which node is a user connected to? If a user complains of performance issues or gets an error or anything, it might be helpful to know which of the two (soon to be six) nodes they are connected to. Two browser sessions connected to the alias (the load balancer) look identical. I just want to see the hostname on the footer, or somewhere, so I can debug issues.{quote} *Suggestion* Install as standard somewhere on the page (ideally the footer where it is hidden in plain sight) or able to indicate this node is belong to which hostname. *Workaround* # Take note on the node 1 and 2 hostname. If you couldn't find it, you may open the Load Balancer configuration and review the hostname URL: {code} # JIRA node 1 BalancerMember http://jira1.hostname.com:8080 route=node1 # JIRA node 2 Commented pending node installation # BalancerMember http://jira2.hostname.com:8081 route=node2 {code} # Go to the node 1 installation directory and navigate to this path: {code}jira-install/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/templates/plugins/footer/footer.vm{code} # Open the footer.vm file. # Search for the {{$licenseMessageClass}} and add this parameter before the {{$licenseMessageClass}}. For example: {code}

Footer:

#if($licenseMessageClass)
  • #if($unlicensed) {code} (i) Replace '' value to the node 1 hostname. # Save the file and restart node 1. # Repeat step 2 until 4 for node 2. # Save the file and restart node 2.
fields.summary: As an admin user, it would be great JIRA data center able to show hostname in each nodes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44415].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Certain features available in the Workflow Designer graphic mode may not be available in text mode (some of which is intentional). An example is configuring global transitions. See https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-29873. 

There are sometimes scenarios where transitions and statuses are more easily accessible in text mode, some users may find this mode more suitable when editing workflows, and should be aware of the configuration options that are not available in this mode.

h3. Suggested Solution
Since we have a whole documentation page dedicated to [Working in text mode|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Working+in+text+mode] this may be a good place to note these limitations.
fields.summary: Note limitations in working in text mode documentation
Ability to Set Issue Security Level Based on Select List Custom Field

fields.description:
h5. Summary
If a user has a custom field of type cascading Select List and want to remove the option none, they wouldn't be able to.

Setting the field configuration to required still leaves the option *NONE*, though it would fail to pass letting you know that the field cannot have the option none because it is required.

h5. Steps to reproduce
# Create a custom field of type Select List(Cascading).
# Add the field to the create issue screen and add it's values.
# Go to Field Configuration Page and set the field to required to prevent it from showing the None value.
# Go to create issue page and locate the Custom Field
# If default value was not changed, it will show 'None' -> 'None' as it's values.
# If the default value was changed, it would show the Default value however users would still be able to select the None values as they are still present.

h5. Expected Behaviour
- When a field is set as required, the None value is removed.

h5. Actual Behaviour
- The field still has the 'none' value.
fields.summary: Setting a cascading custom field to require does not remove the option none

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44390].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Our support team includes a CC on all emails to a catchall account that JIRA reads from using its email handler to try to associate to tickets. A lot of these emails cannot be associated with a ticket which JIRA complains about, but it will not remove those emails and will continue to read them every time it checks the account when using POP3 or IMAP. This causes an extremely high load on our database server for some reason, which immediately drops when we remove these old emails.

h3. Suggested Solution
There should be an option for JIRA's email handler to delete messages it cannot associate

h3. Workaround 
Exchange Server/Outlook may see [Delete or mark email automatically at set date|https://www.msoutlook.info/question/automatically-delete-message-at-set-date]
fields.summary: Add option to delete mail that cannot be associated to a ticket
Versions: Make filter more obvious

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44386].
  {panel}

Currently, when a user is assigned to a notification scheme, he or she would receive all notification they have been associated with.

The only way not to get notified is to ask the JIRA Administrator to remove them from the notification scheme or if they were watchers, stop watching the issue itself.

The reason for wanting to opt-out is due to how chatty JIRA notification can get at times and being able to selectively opt-out of notifications by having JIRA add a link to emails sent to them which they can click on should they want to opt-out of notification for just that particular issue.

This way users do not get notified too frequently and they can control in more details what notifications they want to receive and for which issues they'll like to receive notification from.
fields.summary: Allow Users to Opt out of Notifications in JIRA

  {panel}

h3. Summary

When using the Remote Issue Copy plugin to copy an issue between two application linked JIRA instances, if there is a custom field type which the Remote Issue Copy can't map, and there is a custom field in the destination JIRA which is required in the Field Configuration for the project the issue is being moved to, then a NullPointerException is thrown.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Link two JIRAs via application links
# Install Remote Issue Copy plugin on both sides
# Ensure that there is some custom field provided by a third-party addon which is required on the field configuration of the project you want to copy the issue into
# Use remote copy to copy an issue into the project with the required third-party addon custom field

h3. Expected Results

An error message is displayed noting that the custom field type is not supported by the Remote Issue Copy plugin, and there is a required field in the destination of that type.

h3. Actual Results

An error displays in the browser, one of:

* Error occured when remote JIRA instance was processing request
* Remote copy couldn't communicate with remote JIRA instance.

The second error is actually a generic error meaning that the remote side didn't respond before the UI timed out.

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:

{noformat}
2015-07-20 15:38:33,865 http-bio-10634-exec-8 ERROR <username> 937x217x1 znrwnc 172.22.200.130 /rest/copyissue/1.0/copyissue/fieldPermissions [atlassian.cpji.rest.CopyIssueResource] Failed to check field permissions for source issue 'ISSUE-1
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.cpji.fields.permission.CustomFieldMappingChecker.getFieldPermission(CustomFieldMappingChecker.java:112)
	at com.atlassian.cpji.components.CopyIssueService.checkFieldPermissions(CopyIssueService.java:252)
	at com.atlassian.cpji.rest.CopyIssueResource.checkFieldPermissions(CopyIssueResource.java:59)
...etc...
{noformat}

h3.Workaround

# Make it so that affected custom fields are marked optional on the field configuration of the destination JIRA/Project.
fields.summary: Remote Issue Copy throws NullPointerException if an unmapped custom field is required at the destination

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44377].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
In development, it is very common for a company to use Affect Versions and Fix Versions for Bug tickets where *Affected Versions* would be _the version of the product affected by the Bug_ and *Fix Version* would be _the version of the product where the Bug would be fixed_. Therefore it's not possible for a Bug to be in *both* Affected Version and Fix Version. 

h3. Suggestion
Have a default feature where upon resolving a ticket, the Fix Version must *not* contain the same version in the Affected Version. This can be in a general configuration, project configuration or maybe just in the validator, but should be in by default so users do not have to rely on add-ons or custom scripts to implement this since it is a very common usage.

Even better if this can also ensure that the Fix Version is a *later version* when compared to Affected Version. It is not possible for a Fix Version to be _version 1_ while Affected Version is _version 2_
fields.summary: Fix Versions not identical to Affected Versions upon resolving an issue

fields.description:
Yesterday afternoon, I upgraded a Jira 4.4 installation to 6.4.7. After two previous test runs going without a hitch, I was surprised to discover that after the production upgrade, the Jira Subversion plugin failed to install.

Luckily, I still had the second test instance available, and after bringing it up for comparison, noticed that its Universal Plugin Manager was at v2.18.5, while the one refusing to install the plugin was at 2.19.

After replacing the UPM jar with 2.18.5, the SVN plugin installed fine.

Here's an example of the log output for a failed SVN plugin installation attempt using UPM v2.19:
{noformat}2015-07-16 17:21:33,953 UpmAsynchronousTaskManager:thread-4 ERROR kbc6f 1041x250x1 1gw6bgp 128.143.1.90 /rest/plugins/1.0/ [upm.core.install.ObrPluginInstallHandler] OBR resolver has 3 unsatisfied requirements for installing plugin.8221279385409228713.atlassian-jira-subversion-plugin-2.0.6.obr
2015-07-16 17:21:33,953 UpmAsynchronousTaskManager:thread-4 ERROR kbc6f 1041x250x1 1gw6bgp 128.143.1.90 /rest/plugins/1.0/ [upm.core.install.ObrPluginInstallHandler] Unsatisfied requirement: (&(package=org.springframework.beans.factory)(version>=2.5.6))

2015-07-16 17:21:33,953 UpmAsynchronousTaskManager:thread-4 ERROR kbc6f 1041x250x1 1gw6bgp 128.143.1.90 /rest/plugins/1.0/ [upm.core.install.ObrPluginInstallHandler] Unsatisfied requirement: (|(ee=J2SE-1.3))
2015-07-16 17:21:33,976 UpmAsynchronousTaskManager:thread-4 WARN kbc6f 1041x250x1 1gw6bgp 128.143.1.90 /rest/plugins/1.0/ [upm.core.install.DefaultPluginInstallationService] Plugin installation failed: Failed to resolve plugin dependencies within OBR [plugin.8221279385409228713.atlassian-jira-subversion-plugin-2.0.6.obr]. h3. Summary
* Due dates from email notification are having -1 day value comparing to the issue view on JIRA
* JIRA System Timezone has been configured to +3 (Moscow) 
* The user's profile timezone has been configured to +4(Samara)
* This problem is impacting US timezones

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure JIRA System Timezone to +3 Moscow
!moscow.png|thumbnail!
# Configure user's profile timezone to +4 Samara
# !samara.png|thumbnail!
# Make sure the create issue screen of the project has the due date field
# Create an issue ( with create issue notification configured )
# Check email

h3. Expected Results
# Due date  will be the same as the JIRA Issue (24/Jul/15)
!due2.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
# Due date is one day earlier than the actual due Date on the JIRA Issue ( 23/Jul/15 )
!due1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
# For the 1st Server : Configure the server system timezone to +4 , User profile timezone to +4
# For the 2nd Server : Configure the server system timezone to -4 , User profile timezone to -4
fields.summary: Notification due date is showing incorrectly for some time zones

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you upgrade JIRA using the Windows installer, and you have JIRA installed as a service, the Java Options from the registry does not remain.

h3. Environment
* Windows

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install using Installer, JIRA 6.1.7 as a service.
# Set Properties for Windows Services via the Windows Registry
Eg: 
-Datlassian.mail.senddisabled=true
-Datlassian.mail.fetchdisabled=true
-Datlassian.mail.popdisabled=true
# Upgrade using installer to JIRA 6.4.7.

h3. Expected Results
JIRA maintains the Registry values after the upgrade.

h3. Actual Results
The Java Options from the registry does not remain. Instead it returns to the default entries.

h3.Workaround
Manually re-add the registry values

h3. Notes
# This issue could cause major inconvenience to Admins, especially if they loose their disabled email settings as shown in the example above.
# I have attached screenshots of the of the registry settings before and after the upgrade.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44350].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The issue collector allows for a number of fields to be added to a modal window, when adding a number of fields in a custom issue collector the description field is too large, and forces scroll bars onto the window. 

As a result users may miss seeing the fields at the bottom of the window.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the fields to be resized to fit the form, whether though the UI or through the custom issue collector customization.
fields.summary: As an Admin, I would like to resize the description in the JIRA issue collector

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44344].
  {panel}

As an administrator you can analyse project role usage before deleting one. 

At the moment only notification, permission and issue security level schemes are analysed together with active workflows that may contain Project Role condition. This isn't enough. You can restrict visibility of comments and worklogs to a Project Role, also inactive workflows may have references to a role that is about to be deleted. 

Right now JIRA gives inaccurate picture of a project role usage.

Also, the summary page displayed before one deletes a role with associations is incomplete and doesn't show the whole picture which may result in administrator taking action on a false premise.
fields.summary: View Usage for Project Role doesn't analyze comments, worklogs and inactive workflows

fields.description:
This affects the Quick Links gadget. 

These gadgets will always make a GET request that is eventually cancelled when it loads. The request for Quick Links gadget looks like the following:
{code}
Request URL:http://localhost:8060/plugins/servlet/gadgets/ifr?container=atlassian&mid=10100&country=US&lang=en&view=default&view-params=%7B%22writable%22%3A%22true%22%7D&st=atlassian%3AJoXHBO24MWb79pAl6UaWCM5F0NS31Cjps%2FG83rQz5upWfPKoXlp%2FN%2BvzS4uw%2Bec2Pz%2BtKJ2WgT1AZQ2F2h4Q99m5CaSgWY6uBLSFeq1sJAkVAeUUGAtS4ubW57%2FVFmEuR9ZBkKi%2B9u7mtQ5A7QgvkTzCxG3d7ILgTxqsZsD8cQQNSVbMEnCwU0wTkkmzgR21lhPN0XTlDTYhDxVRWIdirLbNdmFCHaAp9KQ%2FbCq1fIBe6vgFTiQUpAB7VwUhmcj%2Fyq2UpIyHDmQClrLwRuhGAerUjGcBuCdlRioji%2BCBIBUJyTKf&url=http%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%3A8060%2Frest%2Fgadgets%2F1.0%2Fg%2Fcom.atlassian.jira.gadgets%3Aquicklinks-gadget%2Fgadgets%2Fquicklinks-gadget.xml&libs=auth-refresh
{code}
This is also observed on jira.atlassian.com when you load the default dashboard that contains the Quick Links gadget.
!QuickLins.png|thumbnail!

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Create a dashboard that has the Quick Links gadget. 
# Open Chrome Developer tools, select the {{Network Tab}}.
# Refresh the dashboard.
# Observe that there is a single request that gets cancelled. (see above for the full request)

h4. Side Effects
There are no apparent side effects to this cancelled request. Everything loads properly. 

h4. Workaround
There are no workarounds.
fields.summary: Quick Links gadget always sends a request that is eventually cancelled

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On JIRA 6.x, Emojis are no longer rendered when followed by numbers or by double-type characters, although they used to be rendered on JIRA 5.x.

Please see attached JIRA5-emoji.png and JIRA6-emoji.png, which were created by using the following description:
{noformat}
:) :( :P :D ;) (y) (n) (i) (/) (x) (!) ... Followed by a white space
:)?:(?:P?:D?;)?(y)?(n)?(i)?(/)?(x)?(!)? ... Followed by a question mark
:)a:(b:Pc:Dd;)e(y)f(n)g(i)h(/)i(x)j(!)k ... Followed by a alphabet
:)0:(1:P2:D3;)4(y)5(n)6(i)7(/)8(x)9(!)0 ... Followed by a number
:)あ:(い:Pう:Dえ;)お(y)甲(n)乙(i)丙(/)丁(x)戊(!)己 ... Followed by a double-byte character
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results

Those emojis are rendered on JIRA 6.x as well as JIRA 5.x to keep backward compatibility

h3. Actual Results

When followed by a number or by a double-byte character, emojis used to be render on JIRA 5.x but not on JIRA 6.x anymore.
fields.summary: Emojis are no longer rendered when followed by numbers or by double-byte characters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44338].
  {panel}

The issue collector only allows for users with the jira-user global permission to raise issues.
If the email address used in the form it not mapped to a user with this permission, the default reporter will be used instead.

If the issue collector is being used for a Service Desk project, requests raised by customers will always be set with the default reporter since customers (generally) do not have the jira-user global permission, even though their email address can be mapped to a user with the permission to raise issues in the Service Desk project.

This causes inconsistencies for the reporter of such issues, and prevents the issue being visible for the actual reporter.

Can functionality get implemented for the issue collector to recognise customers as valid reporters when using the issue collector on Service Desk projects?
fields.summary: JIRA Issue collector does not recognise customer user types as valid reporters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44337].
{panel}
The issue collector allows only for the issue type to be chosen when setting up the collector.
 If the issue collector is intended to be used with a Service Desk project, these issues will not show up in queues and under requests in the Service Desk itself due to the absence of a value for the request type field.

Adding the request type as a configuration option when setting up the issue collector allows for it to be used for Service Desk projects.

Additionally, if the issue collector is configured to _Attempt to match user session of submitter or submitter email address,_ if the user does not have _Application access (license)_ and _Create issues permission_ for the project, the default issue reporter you specify in it will be used as the issue's reporter, and this means that all customers will have their issues created by the default reporter, so this restriction would also require being addressed to allow Customers using Issue collectors seamlessly for service desk.
fields.summary: Add request type as a configurable option to the issue collector for Service Desk projects

fields.description:
h4. +Steps to reproduce+
# Edit the default Resolve Issue Screen and add Attachment field to it (if it's not there yet)
# Make sure the Closed step of a Test workflow has the property {{jira.issue.editable}} set to *false* (default) and all Close Issue transitions use the above Resolve Issue Screen
# Open an issue using the above Test workflow for example and make sure it's not Closed yet
# Click the Close Issue button to pop up the Resolve Issue Screen, attach a file from that screen, and click Close

h4. +Expected behavior+
The attached file is added to the issue

h4. +Actual behavior+
The attached file is NOT added to the issue and the following warning is seen in the log:
{code}
2015-07-16 14:24:03,189 http-bio-8686-exec-15 WARN admin 864x1899x1 dt381w 192.168.1.100,0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/CommentAssignIssue.jspa [jira.issue.fields.AttachmentSystemField] There were errors while converting temporary attachments: AttachmentError{logMessage='An error occurred: You can not create attachments as the issue is in a non-editable workflow state.', localizedMessage='You can not create attachments as the issue is in a non-editable workflow state.', filename='', reason=VALIDATION_FAILED, exception=none()}
{code}

{panel}(!) Though the warning seems to be logical, but this kind of behavior does not occur in JIRA 6.3.15, in which files can still be attached when closing an issue using exactly the same screen and workflow property.

(x) Seems that this behavior is introduced in JIRA 6.4.x where issues are Closed before JIRA tries to add the attached files, causing file attachments to fail.
{panel}

h4. +Workarounds+
# Workaround 1: Use Attach Files function to attach files before closing an issue
# Workaround 2: Update the workflow and remove the workflow property from Closed step
(!) this also means that issues can be edited after being Closed
fields.summary: Cannot add attachments when closing issues

h4. +Steps to reproduce+
# Edit the default Resolve Issue Screen and add Attachment field to it (if it's not there yet)
# Make sure the Closed step of a Test workflow has the property {{jira.issue.editable}} set to *false* (default) and all Close Issue transitions use the above Resolve Issue Screen
# Open an issue using the above Test workflow for example and make sure it's not Closed yet
# Click the Close Issue button to pop up the Resolve Issue Screen, attach a file from that screen, and click Close

h4. +Expected behavior+
The attached file is added to the issue

h4. +Actual behavior+
The attached file is NOT added to the issue and the following warning is seen in the log:
{code}
2015-07-16 14:24:03,189 http-bio-8686-exec-15 WARN admin 864x1899x1 dt381w 192.168.1.100,0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/CommentAssignIssue.jspa [jira.issue.fields.AttachmentSystemField] There were errors while converting temporary attachments: AttachmentError{logMessage='An error occurred: You can not create attachments as the issue is in a non-editable workflow state.', localizedMessage='You can not create attachments as the issue is in a non-editable workflow state.', filename='', reason=VALIDATION_FAILED, exception=none()}
{code}

{panel}(!) The warning sounds logical, but this kind of behavior does not occur in JIRA 6.3.15, in which files can still be attached when closing an issue using exactly the same screen and workflow property.

(x) Seems that this behavior is introduced in JIRA 6.4.x where issues are Closed before JIRA tries to add the attached files, causing file attachments to fail.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44332].
  {panel}

According to REST API documentation for Delete Group, you can pass a swapGroup query param (which is optional) which is "a group to transfer visibility restrictions of the group that is being deleted". 

One could expect that passing the param would result in replacing deleted group with swapped group in all schemes (permission, notification, issue security) but also comments and worklogs where you restricted visibility. Which is not true. The group is swapped only for comments and worklogs. Someone decided that "visibility restrictions" stands only for these two entities. However you do restrict visibility of an issue by setting its security level, don't you?

Probably we can't change behaviour of the resource (it's part of API) and underlying GroupService, but we can at least document it better, as is the GroupService#deleteGroup documented, so it's clear what will get swapped.

We'd also consider retiring GroupService#deleteGroup and DELETE /group?swapGroup behaviour in favour of swapping groups in comments and worklogs but also all schemes, which will make it consistent with RoleService and DELETE /role implementation, which (will) swap role in comments, worklogs, and schemes.
fields.summary: Ambiguous swapGroup parameter in Delete Group REST API

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After migrating JIRA from MySQL/PostgreSQL/Cloud to SQL Server, the following error occurred when the Integrity Checker runs. In this example, JIRA has 2 workflow with the name 'purchases' and 'Purchases'. 
{code:borderStyle=solid}
SELECT id,workflowname FROM jiraschema."jiraworkflows" where workflowname = 'purchases'

id	workflowname
10022	purchases
12820	Purchases
{code}
{noformat}
Technical details
Log's referral number: b52389f3-69c3-4a3c-96da-89cc5c3f600f
Cause
Referer URL: http://jiratest/secure/admin/IntegrityChecker!default.jspa
com.atlassian.jira.appconsistency.integrity.exception.IntegrityException: Error occurred while performing check.
com.atlassian.jira.appconsistency.integrity.exception.IntegrityException: Error occurred while performing check.
	at com.atlassian.jira.appconsistency.integrity.check.WorkflowCurrentStepCheck.doCheck(WorkflowCurrentStepCheck.java:167)
	at com.atlassian.jira.appconsistency.integrity.check.WorkflowCurrentStepCheck.preview(WorkflowCurrentStepCheck.java:54)
	at com.atlassian.jira.appconsistency.integrity.IntegrityChecker.preview(IntegrityChecker.java:63)
	at com.atlassian.jira.appconsistency.integrity.IntegrityChecker.previewWithIds(IntegrityChecker.java:35)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.IntegrityChecker.doExecute(IntegrityChecker.java:71)
...
Caused by: com.atlassian.cache.CacheException: java.lang.IllegalStateException: There are more than one workflows associated with 'Purchases' in the database!
	at com.atlassian.cache.memory.DelegatingCache$DelegatingLoadingCache.get(DelegatingCache.java:270)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.CachingWorkflowDescriptorStore.getWorkflow(CachingWorkflowDescriptorStore.java:68)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.JiraWorkflowFactory.getWorkflow(JiraWorkflowFactory.java:37)
	at com.opensymphony.workflow.config.DefaultConfiguration.getWorkflow(DefaultConfiguration.java:89)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.OSWorkflowManager.getWorkflow(OSWorkflowManager.java:202)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.OSWorkflowManager.getWorkflow(OSWorkflowManager.java:548)
	at com.atlassian.jira.appconsistency.integrity.check.WorkflowCurrentStepCheck.doCheck(WorkflowCurrentStepCheck.java:111)
	... 188 more
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalStateException: There are more than one workflows associated with 'Purchases' in the database!
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.OfBizWorkflowDescriptorStore.getWorkflowDescriptorGV(OfBizWorkflowDescriptorStore.java:155)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.OfBizWorkflowDescriptorStore.getWorkflow(OfBizWorkflowDescriptorStore.java:46)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.CachingWorkflowDescriptorStore$WorkflowCacheLoader.load(CachingWorkflowDescriptorStore.java:139)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.CachingWorkflowDescriptorStore$WorkflowCacheLoader.load(CachingWorkflowDescriptorStore.java:132)
...
{noformat}

h3. Environment
* JIRA on MS SQL Server
* Recommended collation used - {{SQL_Latin1_General_CP437_CI_AI}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA with MySQL/PostgreSQL or grab a Cloud backup and skip to step 4
# Create two workflow with the following names. This will be 2 distinct workflows.
#* Purchases 
#* purchases
# Create an XML backup
# Deploy a JIRA with SQL Server
# Restore XML backup
# Run Integrity Checker

h3. Notes
# MySQL is case sensitive so it reads the workflow as separate entity; however, SQL Server is case insensitive thus throwing the error
# Case sensitivity should be similar across all supported database for JIRA

h3.Workaround
# Shutdown JIRA
# Manually update the database to change one of the workflow name so you have a distinct name for each workflow
# Restart JIRA
fields.summary: Integrity Checker error when migrating from MySQL/PostgreSQL/Cloud to SQL Server
